Description: Upper body sherd of East Greek pottery closed vessel, possibly a slim amphora; exterior: three rows of rough black (fired brown) scales preserved.
Curator's comments: According to Cook (1952, p. 143 b), the sherd is not from a Clazomenian vessel but was probably influenced by Clazomenian pottery. The lack of dots, white or otherwise, in the scales speaks against Klazomenai.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (pl. 9, no. 28)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 143 b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.715)
